content: Securities ETF Dividends Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 22 Mar 2019Are dividends from US shares and etf taxable by iras? And do we need to declare these dividends as income unlike SG shares because it is not one-tier?Divends and taxes. Are overseas income to be declared as income3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 23 Mar 2019The dividends received in your account from US based stocks are already less 30% due to withholding taxes. There's no need for declaration to iras as far as I know0 comments0

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 07 Jun 2019US stocks withholding taxes need not be declared to IRAS.The dividends you get are already taxed on the US side. The amount you received is always after tax.2 comments0

Question Poster23 Mar 2019That means to say 1 tax style like singapore dividend. Sure? coz i'm unsure of filing to IRAS as No dividend income for the US ones... Many thanksGabriel Tham23 Mar 2019Yes, I also have US stocks, no need to file to IRAS. What you received is already after tax.
Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 23 Mar 2019It is not taxable hence you do not have to declare.0 comments0
